titleInfo.title: Jake Lederman and Harsh Lederman Delivering Milk

physicalDescription.note: Handwritten on envelope: "#391 Jake Lederman c. 1910." Handwritten notes on back of photograph: "From the City of Lakewood Calendar 1980, Jake Lederman #391." There is also a typed caption taped to the back of the photograph which reads: "Jake Lederman helps his father deliver milk in downtown Denver, March, 1911. Their Green Mountain Dairy was located at the southwest corner of West 1st Avenue and Wadsworth Boulevard on land bought from the George Devinny family. (Photo courtesy of Jake Lederman)."

mods.abstract: Jake Lederman helps his father Harsh Lederman deliver milk by horse drawn carriage, in downtown Denver, Colorado in March, 1911. Their Green Mountain Dairy was located at the southwest corner of West 1st Avenue and Wadsworth Boulevard on land bought from the George Devinny family. This is a page from the 1980 City of Lakewood Calendar.
